Player History
Drafted in 2nd round, 41st overall pick, by Diablo in 1968...
Injured on 8/21/1968 with a Scratched Cornea Eye, out for 1-2 weeks...
Injured on 6/8/1970 with a Inflamed Back Muscle, out for one week...
Injured on 8/4/1972 with a Bruised Foot, out for 4 days...
Traded from Diablo to Boston (FBA) on 2/6/1973 (Going to DIA: 1B R. Tyler, P B. Triche, LF R. Silvas, P D. Plaza. Going to SHP: 1B B. Treadway)...
Had first career hit on 4/1/1973, off James Boos (MAN)...
Hit first career homerun on 4/4/1973, off Benjamin Costin (NJ)...
Had 5 hits with 4 RBI against Plum Grove on 8/3/1973...
Won Slick Fielder Award at First Base in 1973...
Won Player of the Week award on 7/21/1974, hitting .619 with 0 HR, 6 RBI...
Won Slick Fielder Award at First Base in 1974...
Won Player of the Week award on 4/28/1976, hitting .440 with 2 HR, 7 RBI...
Won Batter of the Month award on 5/1/1976, hitting .438 with 4 HR, 24 RBI...
Was selected to the 1976 Allstar game...
Had 5 hits with 5 RBI against Plum Grove on 5/26/1977...
Won Player of the Week award on 6/2/1977, hitting .556 with 4 HR, 13 RBI...
Had 5 hits with 5 RBI against Malibu on 6/7/1977...
Was selected to the 1977 Allstar game...
Had 30-game hitting streak snapped on 8/29/1977...
Won World Championship with Boston (FBA) in 1977...
Won Slick Fielder Award at First Base in 1977...
Won Player of the Week award on 9/22/1978, hitting .565 with 2 HR, 7 RBI...
Won World Championship with Boston (FBA) in 1980...
Signed as a free agent by Pontiac on 2/10/1982 to a 4-year deal worth $3,013,200 per year...
Drove in 7 runs against Coney Island on 4/15/1982...
Was selected to the 1983 Allstar game...
Won World Championship with Pontiac in 1983...
Released by Pontiac on 4/7/1986...
